task.summary: Default task

Update method transpose for correct working method. Was changed a permutation mechanism for correct permutation Tensor by specified axis and added more exceptions for check permutation indices on true indices.
Added batch size for test data. This was done because these layers were recently updated for parallel processing of batches

Add unit tests for BPE class to verify tokenization functionality
- Introduced a new BPETest fixture for managing setup and teardown of the BPE object. - Added test cases to validate the correct tokenization of various words: - "lowert" is expected to tokenize to {"low", "er", "t"}. - "lower" is expected to tokenize to {"low", "er"}. - "slowest" is expected to tokenize to {"s", "low", "e", "s", "t"}. - Ensured that the BPE class is functioning as expected with the provided vocabulary and merge rules.
Updated expected data for transpose this was made it because early we update implementation of this method in Tensor.tpp.
Minor update was deleted unnecessary includes

Added new files.
src/LayerNorm.tpp include/BPE.h src/BPE.tpp utils/loadAGNews.h utils/loadMNIST.h utils/loadWikiText.tpp utils/swapEndian.tpp

Refactored Transformer implementation with intermediate checkpoint:
- Removed `PositionalEncoder` and integrated `Tokenizer` for tokenization and positional encoding. - Updated embedding layers to use a single `Embedding` instance shared across both source and target sequences. - Modified `Transformer` constructor and forward method to accommodate the updated architecture. - Implemented support for `SOS` and `EOS` tokens to handle sequence shifting for autoregressive tasks. - Introduced new final dense layers with softmax activation for output probabilities. - Refined parameter and gradient management for enhanced modularity. - Added placeholder methods for loading and saving model weights. - Adjusted training loop to tokenize data upfront and handle sequence padding and shifting effectively. - Note: This commit serves as an intermediate checkpoint towards a complete implementation of the model.
Further refinements and testing are needed to complete the implementation.

Optimized Activation Functions Implementation: Refactored the Softmax forward pass to improve efficiency by reducing redundant computations and in-place operations. Optimized the backward pass to streamline the gradient computation by eliminating nested loops and leveraging precomputed dot products. Ensured consistency in forward and backward methods across all activation functions. Maintained a consistent style in handling input and gradient tensors. Introduced in-place operations and input caching in ReLU for efficiency. Simplified LeakyReLU and ELU to enhance readability and performance. This commit enhances the performance and maintainability of the activation functions in the neural network implementation, ensuring faster execution during both the forward and backward passes.
Small changes were implemented for better brevity
Deleted comment for better brevity

Refactored Embedding Layer Implementation:
- Simplified the forward method by changing the input tensor requirement from 2D to 1D, improving usability and aligning with the common usage pattern for embedding layers. - Updated the backward method to handle 2D gradients, improving consistency with the new forward method structure. - Removed unnecessary parallelization in the forward method for simpler, more readable code. - Optimized gradient accumulation in the backward method for better performance. - Improved input validation with more accurate error messages for tensor shape mismatches. - Code is now more streamlined and better suited for typical embedding layer applications in sequence models.
Added method remove empty sentences for reducing unnecessary dataset size
Updated method `InitializerParameter` which used better random number generator
Deleted positional encoder class because it is unnecessary

Refactored PositionalWiseDenseLayer Implementation:
- Simplified the forward and backward passes by removing redundant checks and ensuring input dimensions are validated with concise error messages. - Streamlined matrix operations by eliminating unnecessary reshaping and transposing, leading to improved readability and performance. - Updated gradient calculations to directly utilize the transposed and summed tensors, ensuring more efficient memory usage. - Improved the error handling in both forward and backward passes to provide clearer feedback on dimension mismatches. - Code is now more efficient, easier to maintain, and better aligned with typical use cases in sequence models.
Renamed class for better breviary
Updated dot method for parallel processing sum
Changed expected data for better testing and provided a new test case in test_multi_head_attention.cpp after changes the main logic of the layer
Minor changes Tokenizer class for brevity and more wide docs with comments

Refactor and Implement Separate Methods for Downloading and Extracting Vocabulary
- Split the vocab processing logic into two separate methods: `download_vocab` and `extract_vocab`. - `download_vocab` handles the creation and population of the vocabulary file using datasets like AG_NEWS and WikiText. - `extract_vocab` processes the SentencePiece model output, filtering out unwanted tokens and saving the final vocabulary. - Improved code readability and maintainability by modularizing the functionality. - Updated the main script to reflect these changes and ensure smooth integration.
Minor updates for better brevity
Minor updates for better brevity

Implemented the load_vocab function in C++ to load vocabulary from a file, where each line represents a word. The function reads the specified file, loads each word into a vector of strings, and ignores empty lines. Added necessary error handling to throw a runtime exception if the file cannot be opened. Additionally, provided detailed documentation for the function to clarify its usage and expected behavior.
Deleted Eigen installation because we had installed it directly to the project
Added optimization for weights initialization over Eigen
Updated `dot` method and `transpose`. Was rewritten methods over Eigen for better performance because we're using this method the most often.
Minor updates in building vocabulary changed from input datasets to vocabulary with type vector of strings for better brevity
Minor updates in building vocabulary changed from input datasets to vocabulary with type vector of strings for better brevity
Changed vocabulary size from 20000 to 30000 and added special symbols and numbers
There Were added docs and more comments for better brevity and was deleted inverseVocabularyBuild because this method was unnecessary.
Updated expected data after previous changes
Updated expected data after previous changes
Optimized to lower a mechanism in method `textToIds`

Refactored `Transformer` class for improved data handling and efficiency:
- Updated `Tokenizer` initialization in `Transformer` constructor to handle the entire length including special tokens. - Refined the `train`, `predict`, and `generate_text` methods for better clarity and performance. - Reorganized and cleaned up `forward`, `backward`, and `update` methods for consistency. - Removed unnecessary redundant code and outdated comments to streamline the implementation. - Ensured more accurate token processing and gradient accumulation during training.
This refactor enhances readability and prepares the codebase for further optimizations.
Added conan requirements for the project for using `make test` and `make build` commands for building and testing the project.
Added new files of the project and some changes in the names some files for correct grammar.
Added `download_data` command for downloading datasets and vocab
Changed actual pip version for the project
Changed imports from utils_py.* to (directory_space).*
Small changes for better brevity

Add training pipeline for Transformer model using WikiText dataset
- Implemented data loading for WikiText and vocabulary. - Defined Transformer model with training loop. - Added support for cross-entropy loss and Adam optimizer with learning rate scheduler. - Configured training with 10 epochs and batch size of 128. - Saved model weights during and after training.
Renamed method `generate_text` to `generate`.

Add text generation pipeline for Transformer model
- Implemented text generation using pre-trained Transformer model. - Loaded WikiText test dataset and vocabulary for inference. - Set up Transformer model with loaded weights. - Added text generation function with a configurable number of tokens. - Included necessary parameters such as learning rate scheduler, optimizer, and loss function.
Added new files as `src/train.cpp` and `src/generate.cpp`
Some testing current architecture of the model and method `predict`
Pushed changes, minor update
Minor updates changed version conan from ~=2.5.0 to ==2.7.0
Was added correct setup Eigen
Added a correct generation text from all test data and added displaying generated text.
